## Overview

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

This advanced course focuses on the theory and application of Generalised Linear Models, tailored for PhD students and researchers. The course is designed to be non-field specific meaning it can be taken by geologists to marketers and any in between.

### Topics Covered

- Introduction to statistical modelling and GLMs  
- Poisson GLMs  
- Binomial GLMs  
- Bernoulli GLMs

## Learning Objectives

- Understand the core structure of GLMs
- Fit models using R
- Translate statistical equations into model syntax
- Interpret coefficients and results with confidence
- Recognise when assumptions are violated
